intro: Brunellia antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in Colombia. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, palmate leaves, and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and mountainous forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
